12/09/1947 0 Born on December 9, 1947 as James Godwin.
Father incarcerated at a federal prison. His mother, Hazel Godwin, took James and
moved to Pocatello, Idaho and remarried shortly after.
1953 6 Developed a hatred for police/ authority figures
1955 8 Mother died in a potato processing plant fire.
James received counseling at St. Anthony’s Youth Correction Center in Idaho (one
1961 14 Stole a car and set fire to dumpsters
1961 14  Became a ward of the state
James was released from reform school under the condition that he leave the state
1964 17 and live with his natural father in Louisiana where he began to work in his father’s
business of selling and installing chain fences.
He escaped from prison by threatening a guard’s life with a knife ( His only
successful escape out of seven attempts)
1966 19 Killed a colt that was tied to a tree as a Christmas gift
Married first wife, Angie Bell, and had a child. Angie filed for divorce a few
months later after learning about James’ sentence to prison.
Remarried Angie and had another child, but a few months later Angie filed for a
James was released from Angola State Penitentiary and moved to Texas and lived
with his half brother Earnest Arnold. Went to work as a truck driver for a carnival
1986 39 out of Tyler, Texas. Moved out of Arnold’s home after Arnold disapproved of
James’ relationship with a gay man named Jimmy Twiggs that he had met at
James injured his left hand, severely cutting three of his fingers. The fingers were
surgically repaired but his hand still remained weak.
10/1992 45 Denver, Colorado – robbed a Pizza Hut.
10/31/1992 45 Pocatello, Idaho – James arrives at his cousin’s, Dave Haggard, and asks for a place

column3: to live. Haggard agrees to let him stay until he could get back on his feet.
Got a job as a dishwasher at Tina’s Ox Bow Restaurant, but used his spare time tomake paintings on old handsaws and began to sell them.
Abducted and raped 15 year old Beth Edwards from a Pizza Hut parking lot.
Wood raped a 14 year old Karen, Daughter of his girlfriend
Robbed Sizzler Steak house in Salt Lake City
Raped a Women after picking her up off street in Salt Lake City (same day asSizzler Steak house Robbery)
Wood abducted and killed Jeralee Underwood, age 10, a newspaper carrier in thearea. He brought her into the woods and shot and dismembered her body as she gotout to use the bathroom.
Wood is arrested for the murder of Jeralee Underwood
Wood is sentenced to death by lethal injection for the murder of JeraleeUnderwood. Wood confessed to killing s Louisiana woman in 1976.
Sixth district judge rejects Wood’s appeal
Idaho State Supreme Court rejects Wood’s appeal for the third time
Supreme Court justice O’Connor signed a stay of execution until Wood’s deathsentence appeal could be heard by the entire U.S Supreme Court
U.S. Supreme Court refused to hear Wood’s appeal
Died from a heart attack while on death row.

column2: Convicted of killing 1(believed to have killed dozens),confessed to 2 murders, raped 85 women, responsible for 185robberies
Uncle Gene and Aunt Mildred Wood after mother died in1955; due to James’ problems the Wood relatives relinquishedtheir custody and James became a ward of the state.

Father incarcerated at a federal prison when James was 2 yearsold; at this time James and his mother moved to Pocatello, IDwhere his mother remarried. His mother died in a fire whileworking in a potato factory when James was 8 years old. Jameswas in school right across the street and watched the fire.
A 160-180lb Caucasian male with short brown hair---fit in andwas not noticeable physically by others around him.
1990 – Severely injured 3 fingers on his left hand while using apower saw – had surgery, but still had problems using his hand.
James claimed he was physically abused by his step-father.
James claimed he was psychologically abused by his step-father.
James claimed he was sexually abused by his step-father.
Business selling and installing chain fences
Most of teenage years he was in a youth correction center andattended a reform school in Idaho until 17.

column2: James had trouble holding down jobs where he was fired or hejust quit and would not return to that place of employment towork.

Installed chain fences, carnival truck driver, painted old sawsand metal milk jugs with wild life scenes for money &dishwasher, but he usually stole money to survive. Wood didnot like to work because it was “too boring”.
Heterosexual - homosexual tendencies began in prison
Impulsive, anti-social, no conscience, lack of remorse, sexualsadism, violent outbursts, sensitive to criticism, unpredictable,loner
Served 4.5 years in Angola State Penitentiary (1967-1971).Served a second sentence of 6 years out of 10 for robbery andrape. He was released for good behavior.
Not certain- Convicted of 1 killing and suspected of multipleothers
